newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - Indian GDRs down on position-squaring.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - Indian GDRs down on position-squaring.

text.p: Position-squaring ahead of the weekend combined with weak demand softened prices of Indian and Korean GDRs while shares in Taiwanese firms held firm on Friday.
"There was some selling pressure in a few Indian blue chips but it was mainly adjustments of deals," a dealer said.
The bull run on Indian Hotels witnessed in the last few weeks came to an end as it shed $1.62 to close at 22.5.
"The premiums is more realistic," a trader said.
Although most GDRs of Indian firms like Century Textiles, Bajaj Auto and ITC were marked lower, traders said it was mainly on speculation by market makers.
"It was just a little bit of profit booking, nothing to do with fundamentals", a dealer said.
Brokers said they expected Indian GDRs to remain sluggish in the run-up to the central budget on February 28.
Dealers said lack of institutional support in Bombay would have its impact on GDRs.
"Its always like that before the budget," a dealer said.
The Cazenove GDR index down 2.10 points or 2.65 percent down at 77.12 while the Capel GDR index was down 2.45 points or 3.43 percent at 68.96.
Korean GDRs came under selling pressure with a few Far East traders squaring up positions on Friday.
The Capel Korea GDR index fell 3.25 points or 5.17 percent to 59.59 while the Capel Taiwan index reflecting a quiet trade, held firm at 104.56, gaining just 0.74 points or 0.71 percent.
